channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban accused of killing pregnant police officer
item.description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

item.title: Planes stranded at Mazar-i-Sharif airport waiting to leave
item.description: A US lawmaker accuses the Taliban of not letting several planes of Afghans and Americans leave.

item.title: India farmers' protests: Tens of thousands join rally in Uttar Pradesh
item.description: A vast crowd of protesters, some riding on tractors, rallied in Uttar Pradesh state.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban says it will 'raise voice for Kashmir Muslims'
item.description: A spokesman for the group tells the BBC it plans to support Muslims in Indian-administered Kashmir.

item.title: North Korea: Kim Jong-un calls for urgent action on climate change
item.description: Typhoons last year badly impacted vital crops, as well as drought and heavy monsoon rains this year.

item.title: Yoshihide Suga to step down as Japan's prime minister
item.description: Mr Suga had been appointed to the role just a year ago following the resignation of Shinzo Abe.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Life in Kabul under Taliban: Where is your male escort?
item.description: Lyse Doucet takes the temperature on the streets of the Afghan capital as the Taliban tighten their grip.

item.title: Afghanistan: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
item.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.
